column2: Radiomen can use equipment in this room to receive transmissions that we receive or send our own reports to Command HQ (BdU).
The attack periscope is, as the name suggests, used to locate enemy ships thanks to a stadimeter and better stability.
The listening room contains equipment that allows our crew to use the hydrophones when submerged and radar detector on the waterÅfs surface.
The pump allows pumping water outside the ship from every compartment but it is the most effective from the central compartment.
The pump allows pumping water outside the ship from every compartment but it is the most effective from the central compartment.
An operating gyrocompass reduces navigation errors by four times.
An operating gyrocompass reduces navigation errors by four times.
Working ventilation is able to effectively increase airÅfs suitability for breathing for a limited time.
The hatch leading outside the ship through a narrow passage.

Electric engines are the only drive source under the water. They do not emit exhaust fumes and are much quieter than diesel engines, however, due to high power consumption, they are unfit for long-distance journeys.
The observation periscope is designed for sky observation and quickly looking around a ship. It can be successfully used to locate an enemy, although it is not the most effective.
Listen for new transmissions we pick up.
Listening on the radio Officer scans frequencies for new transmissions. If ordered, he can decode incoming messages. Additional sailors:
Receiving range increases by 20%. Time needed to receive and send messages is shortened by a factor of two.
Using hydrophone Officer tries to detect new new contacts. If ordered, he can aim torpedoes at a chosen target. Additional sailors:
The targeting sight automatically sends a location to the torpedo room. It is the most efficient equipment for visual observation on the ship.
It regenerates the supplies of compressed air in bottles located outside the pressure hull using the air from inside the ship.
It regenerates the supplies of compressed air in bottles located outside the pressure hull using the air from inside the ship.

A station which allows the rotation of shipÅfs vertical steers on the bow and stern. The operation of the steers can be manual or automatic using an electric engine which rotates the steers. The first method is less accurate and might make it impossible to maintain periscope depth during poor weather, whereas in the second one, the working engines emit a sound which may make it easier for enemies to detect your ship.
Diesel engines require air for work but are very efficient and are the preferred drive source for long journeys. During operation, they generate electric energy.
Deck gun Officer is handling the deck gun. Additional sailors:
Rate of fire increases by 33%. Recoil recovery rate increases by 15%.
Rate of fire increases by 66%. Recoil recovery rate increases by 35%.
Rate of fire increases by 100%. Recoil recovery rate increases by 60%.
Playing cards Officer is playing cards with the crew to improve morale.
The valve column allows for blowing and flooding the ballast tanks on our ship.

Attack Periscope Observation Officer watches for targets increasing u-boat's sight range. If ordered, he can aim torpedoes at a chosen target. Additional sailors:
The sailor operates a torpedo data computer and allows officer to focus on observation. The range of observation increases by 15% and the aiming speed by 25%.
The sailor uses an observation periscope and supports the officer. The overall sight range increases by 20% and the aiming speed by 20%.
Targeting Sight Observation Officer watches for targets increasing u-boat's sight range. If ordered, he can aim torpedoes at a chosen target. Additional sailors:
The range of the observation and the aiming speed increases by 25%.
The range of the observation and the aiming speed increases by 50%.
Navigation Officer constantly updates our position, eliminating risk to get lost when our ship is on the open sea. Additional sailors:
Thanks to better navigation we will save 10% more fuel and energy.
Thanks to better navigation we will save 20% more fuel and energy.
Work - Navigator's station - Fixing ship positionÅc
Fixing ship positionÅc We are lost. Officer is determining our position on the map back again. Additional sailors:
<align="center">Playing cards with the crew will recover their morale over time.

<align="center">The officer assigned to the navigator's table will determine the boat's position in the world by measuring the positions of celestial objects and taking into account ocean currents. Neglecting that may lead to major uncertainty where the boat is located at a given time.
Rest Officer is resting in his bunk and recovers lost energy.
<align="center">The flooding of the ballast tanks will increase the overall mass of the u-boat and push it under the surface of the water.
<align="center">By blowing water from the ballast tanks the overall mass of the u-boat will decrease and push it above the surface of the water.
<align="center">By blowing water from the ballast tanks the overall mass of the u-boat will decrease and push it above the surface of the water.
Managing diesel engines Officer manages Diesel engines, unlocking 4. gear forward and 3. gear backwards. Additional sailors:
All gears are unlocked. Fuel usage drops by 10%. Ordered speed change is executed in at most 6 seconds.
All gears are unlocked. Fuel usage drops by 30%. Ordered speed change is executed in at most 2 seconds.
Managing electric engines Officer manages Electric engines, unlocking 4. gear forward and 3. gear backwards. Additional sailors:
All gears are unlocked. Energy usage drops by 5%.
All gears are unlocked. Energy usage drops by 15%.
Open the window containing details about your current target.
The bilges located under the floor in the central compartment are the lowest point on the ship. Water flowing, for example, through propellers and periscopes is transferred there.

Officer assigned to the navigator's table will determine boat's position in world by measuring celestial objects positions and considering ocean currents. Neglecting that may lead to major uncertainty where the boat is located at a given time.
A cabinet for smaller items of officers.
An operating searchlight increases our sight range at night and during bad weather conditions.
Blocking a leak by a sailor slows down the water leakage rate by 80%.
{0} will be helping the officer in carrying out the tasks.
AA gun Officer is handling the AA gun. Additional sailors:
The winch allows pulling back up a diver or things that he finds at the sea bottom.
The deck gun is designed to sink less armed or abandoned vessels. It can also be used as an anti-aircraft gun with limited efficiency.
Uninstalling the deck gun will increase the underwater speed of the u-boat by decreasing the overall hydrodynamic drag.
The character already has something in his hands.
Salvaging Officer prepares replacement parts from parts recovered from previous repairs.
A device whose purpose is to measure the depth at which the seabed is located.
Depth measurement by supersonic impulse. Undetectable to the enemy, however, it is unable to detect the seabed at over 125 meters.
Depth measurement by sonic impulse. It is detectable for nearby enemies. It has a measurement limit of 1000 meters.
Assigning an officer to the vertical steers station improves the depth keeping of the boat and prevents, for example, accidental broaching to the surface. Diving times are also improved.

column1: Manage Diving Planes Station Full Description
column2: Improving depth keeping Officer works on improving the depth keeping of the boat and prevents, for example, accidental broaching to the surface. Diving times are also improved.
It's being used by somebody else.

Pipe system that may be set above the sea surface to ventillate the ship with fresh air and keep using diesel engines while remaining under water. Works only at the periscope depth.
Snorkel coated with material that disperses incoming radar waves.
Tier I radar detector that is able to detect radar waves and play loud warning on ship's speakers. It's controlled from the listening room and works only on the water surface.
Tier II radar detector. Doesn't emit any radiation detectable for the enemy, but at the cost of detection range.
Tier III radar detector. It's able to detect latest radars using 10 cm waves that are used by the enemy.
Tier IV radar detector with vastly improved range of detection.
Improved hydraulic system that opens up the possibility to use toilets deep under water. Helps for morale.
Tier I accumulators that have their capacity increased by 25% when compared to the default ones.
Tier II accumulators that have their capacity increased by 50% when compared to the default ones.
Tier III accumulators that have their capacity increased by 75% when compared to the default ones.
Default conning tower for Type VIIC u-boats.
Tier I conning tower. It's heavier and more armoured than the default conning tower and is also equipped with two additional 13.2 mm Breda AA guns.
Tier II conning tower. It's fitted with two 20 mm AA guns, one on the conning tower and one more on a separate platform.
Tier III conning tower. It's fitted with two 20 mm AA guns on the conning tower and 37 mm automatic M42 U gun on a separate platform.

Standard hydrophone system mounted on Type VIIC u-boats. Consists of 24 hydrophones mounted on the sides of u-boat's bow. It has two dead zones - 20 degrees arc on the bow and 60 degrees on the stern - from which it cannot capture any sounds.
Tier I hydrophone system. It's a set of 6 hydrophones that can be rotated around one axis. This simple solution allows for perfect triangulation, but placement of this device make it vulnerable.
Tier II hydrophone system. Consists of 48 hydrophones mounted on a dome attached to the bottom part of u-boat's hull. It has only one dead zone that spans 60 degrees on the stern.
Cannot access this device because torpedo is being loaded in this compartment.

column2: The Christmas tree will make the atmosphere on board more pleasant. The sailors will feel the Christmas spirit a little and won't miss their families so much.

This officer is currently monitoring the situation from the control room. He is ready to perform necessary tasks during the combat and can be freely assigned to any work.

This officer will refuse to rest until the combat is over.

Commanding This officer is currently monitoring the situation from the control room. He will send sailors to other stations on the ship to carry his orders and bring back reports. This officer will refuse to rest until the combat is over. Additional sailors:
The sailor communicates the officer and various stations on the ship. All tasks on the ship are executed 5% faster or better.
The sailor communicates the officer and various stations on the ship. All tasks on the ship are executed 10% faster or better.

This officer is currently supervising damage control procedures on the ship from the control room. He will send sailors assigned to him to look for hidden damages around the ship and repair minor issues.

This officer will refuse to rest until the combat is over.

Damage control This officer is currently supervising damage control procedures on the ship from the control room. He will send sailors assigned to him to look for hidden damages around the ship and repair minor issues. This officer will refuse to rest until the combat is over. Additional sailors:
Due to maintaining devices in a good condition, the chance that they will become damaged in any occurrence decreases by 10%. The sailor also inspects compartments for hidden damages.
Due to maintaining devices in a good condition, the chance that they will become damaged in any occurrence decreases by 20%. The sailor also inspects compartments for hidden damages.
